AMAZING cocktails, but definitely not somewhere I would get food. It's expensive and honestly just not good. My "cheese platter" was two chunks of bread, 3 slices of manchego, nuts. and a lil piece of jam. Absolutely not worth the price! For $4 a shrimp I shouldn't have to devein it myself. Bartenders were great and I'll be back for drinks but definitely stay away from the food

The service was a bit awkward and was bumbled a bit. I'm not sure the situation there, but it was offset by one of the best martini I've ever had and very good tapas food. I will also note that for happy hour oysters, they were delicious and quite big. The setting was quite moody and cozy as well, which lent to a nice experience even at the bar and by myself, but would likely serve as a very nice date evening without the full meal commitment.

Came here on a solo date for myself and had a lovely time. Came for their happy hour, had the oysters and a vodka martini. Sat outside and enjoyed the lovely weather and the views of the apartment buildings, quintessential Brooklyn. The service was great as the waiter was knowledgeable of the menu and had a good energy. Would love to come here with friends and enjoy the park next-door looking at the Manhattan skyline.

El Pinguino in Greenpoint is a Spanish tapas and seafood bar serving up some of the freshest seafood towers in NYC. We ordered the seafood tower for dinner which included a dozen oysters, bass ceviche, scallop ceviche, and crab salad. The oysters were among the best we've had in NYC and the scallop ceviche and crab salad were particularly excellent as well. We paired the raw bar with a mineral-forward Txakoli wine from the Basque Country in Spain. Still feeling peckish, we ordered the chorizo and roasted red peppers. Each came with fresh sourdough bread from Shewolf Bakery to mop up the delicious juices. El Pinguino is a must-try for some of the best raw bar in NYC. Be sure to show up during happy hour for half off oysters
Finally a chance to try conservas! Guided by our waiter's suggestions, we greatly enjoyed our tinned fish and oysters.

This Spanish seafood bar has excellent drinks and I love the food options. From the extremely fresh oysters with perfect mignonette to a curated conservas list alongside She Wolf Bakery bread, I would highly recommend making the trip to this restaurant. I would be sure to get the cheesecake. Not to mention, it's got great decor including an AM radio in the bathroom!

What a business model - most of the food is tinned/canned so non-perishable and little-to-no preparation work. And delicious to boot. I love seafood in general, especially tapas from Spain. I had an incredible, dry Basque cider. Fun wine list. The waiter was super helpful and friendly. Cozy, low-key vibe, great for a date or a soft conversation with an old friend. The garlic aioli was a nice touch. The only dish that was underwhelming were the warm peppers - but such is life.

Can't think of a better way to spend a late afternoon than this happy hour.

What an absolute lovely addition to the neighborhood! In the past,  fancy seafood is typically served alongside some smug attitude- but not at El Pinguino! This quaint bar serves excellent seafood like their mango ceviche (insanely delicious) and oysters (the one's we had from Canada were incredible) alongside perfectly made martinis (don't sleep on that happy hour from 4-7!). The staff here is extremely helpful and friendly and we made fast friends with Euan and Michael, both of whom had excellent suggestions and made our experience even that much more enjoyable. Perfect for a date night or just a night out with a friend, El Pinguino is the best way to start out your night, end it or just stay way too long and get very drunk on the sheer bliss of this place. Either way, you'll enjoy every moment of this delightful little bar. Can't wait to come back!

Wonderful Spanish seafood tapa. Great bar and good food with friendly staff. Get there early for happy hour.

Very cool place to try interesting bites. Our waiter was very nice and helped us decide between a few things our favorite was a small dish with Kumar peppers. Just enough heat but tons of flavor. Great date night spot.

This place has quickly become a neighborhood hotspot, especially in the recent months as they switched up the menu. Inside this low lit parlor level restaurant you'll find a pretty decent bar area in the middle of two designated dining spaces in the back and in the front. The service here is amazing. I love being walked through the menu and getting descriptions down to the flavor profiles extra points on wine pairings and you will definitely experience all of that here. All of the plates are pretty different from one another so it's hard to pin down exactly what the cuisine is. But they focus on seasonality and freshness at the forefront. The muscles in an octopus ink sauce we're not only striking an appearance, but flavor as well- very refreshing. I also really enjoy the beef tongue. It was so tender and remind me a pastrami in the best way. And even though I've had it so many times the fried mushrooms were amazing. The batter was so light and crispy. It was unlike any fried mushrooms I've had before. The most lackluster thing I had was the steak and at that price point skip it and grab some other interesting small plates, instead.

New wine bar from the Oxalis team with some excellent food. Definitely get the Bone-in Ray Wing ($44) and the Ricotta Cavatelli ($27) for your mains. Some of the starters are great too, and there are meats and cheeses you can go to go with their delicious bread.

My husband and I had a wonderful date night here. The dishes were creative and well-composed, and the portions were reasonably sized. Can't wait to come back!

Unfortunately this is an overrated place. Food is below average, including but not limited to sardine on toast, puntarelle (nothing like the real ones), and bucatini (overcooked and overwhelming sauce). Since it's overrated it was also wildly overpriced paying 100$ without drinks. Get it straight.

Super excited to have this spot open up in the neighborhood as it will definitely fill a gap in the options close by. We just popped in to have some wine and sample a few dishes - of which all were thoughtfully created, tasty, and high quality - and the team serving them were really great as well. I only wished I'd ordered two of everything so I didn't have to share the smaller plates with my partner! The wine they had was a fun selection and we enjoyed everything they recommended. The restaurant itself is beautiful inside but not in a pretentious way, very approachable, bright and open. Well done to the team here - looking forward to coming for a full meal.

Fantastic meal. Everything was wonderful, but some hits: mussels en tinta, a seafood chowder that was a special, mafaldine, paw paw and smoked date financier (an incredible dessert). Wonderful wine selection, friendly staff. Will be back!

I loooove this place. The staff is so friendly, the ambiance is good, and the dishes are amazing. Order the maitake mushrooms, although you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Be warned that the plates are small!

This was a nice space however I don't think it's quite there. My friend walked in to put our name on the list for a table, and another party who also walked in was seated before us. It was a bit disorganized. We were seated at the 'drink bar' and the bar stools were uncomfortable. We ordered drinks, and my wine glass was warm. There were no silverware or place settings until after they brought our first course. We ordered all four courses and dessert, and by the end my back was hurting from sitting on the stool and leaning over the bar by the end. However, I can see the potential of this place, the dishes were innovative and I particularly liked the pork collar. The waiters were really nice though. Once this place buttons up a bit it seems like it will be great.

Was so eager to go here and it did not disappoint. The menu is constantly changing which surely gives you reasons to keep coming back. We ordered about half the menu. The yellow fish tuna was delicious and the country ham made me want to get on a flight to Spain - so delicious. The tuna belly was an odd dish. Overall pretty eclectic menu. The five stars go primarily to their incredible service! Above and beyond.
Amazing food, wine and service. Honestly one of the better dining experiences I've had in NY where attention to the diner is minimal at best. Can't wait to go back!

Wow, the perfect combination of celebratory and comfortable ... from the food to the wine to the service, it's clear this team knows what they're doing and is thoughtful about creating the ideal restaurant experience. We went on a date but it would be great for friend groups or even a private party in the back. Try the scallops, skate, maitake with black garlic fudge and get their recs on the wine!

This brand new restaurant feels like it's been around for years. The wait staff knows what they're doing and is attentive and efficient and the space is attractive and inviting. The food - all small plates - is very tasty; there wasn't a dish we didn't enjoy. Prices are steep but worth it although we were shocked that there wasn't a bottle of wine for less than $60. It was our feeling that a wine bar should offer a range of price points and if there had been a more affordable bottle we would've stayed for a second round of everything.
food is pretty exceptional, especially the skate and the mushroom. was nice to have a more luxurious option in this neighborhood. definitely a splurge, but well worth it.

I've only been for drinks. I love the Bedstuy area, so it lends to the ambience of the bar. The bartender was very knowledgeable,and allowed me to sample a few spirits. The cocktails were all sensational. I'll need to come back to try the pizza, which came highly recommended.

Food and drinks are great here! We've been here a few times and love the simple menu. Good classic Italian food. Rarely is the service ever off. The backyard is cozy with heaters and cover. So many different kinds of spritz and the funghi pizza is our fav! So much flavors in the dough with perfect crispy crunch. So good!

Without reservations, we (a party of two) were delighted to sit and enjoy a delicious cauliflower soufflé appetizer, a very well made gluten free mushroom, artichoke, and olive pizza, and a couple of finely crafted Negroni cocktails. We really enjoyed the ambience, and sitting so close to the two-top beside us was not as uncomfortable or distracting as you might think. The soft lighting and the light music vibe was really perfect and exactly what we were hoping for. All of the ingredients tasted very high quality, and the service was all very nice and polite. We enjoyed our experience here very much, and we would return, especially for dessert which we did not have time to order. They gave us an hour and a half before the table was reserved for someone else. Just enough time to enjoy a second round of Negronis!

I love this place! Their Roman style pizza is so crisp and well made, and the Negroni are all amazing. Really reasonably priced and a super cute indoor and outdoor space. Highly recommend for a date night or just casual drinks at their beautiful bar! Super happy this place is in the neighborhood and that they made it though the pandemic.

I had the chance to visit bar Camillo on a weekend night to grab drinks with a friend. The bar itself is large with tons of seating. They also have a back area that also has more seating as well. When we arrived we were allowed to sit at two open high chairs at the bar. The bartenders here were super friendly and made each drink we ordered skillfully. I would recommend this spot to catch up with a friend or for a date night. It's a little bit of a walk from the subway but the vibes make it worth it!

I can only speak on the dinner- I thought the pizza was very nice! But the focaccia was very crunchy and the lasagna was just bad. The outdoor patio was heated and comfortable, but the lack of music made it too easy to hear other peoples conversations. There appeared to be only one person on the waitstaff (also bartending) and he kept it together despite being overwhelmed. I'll probably come back here- but just for the drinks

Bar Camillo is a great neighborhood spot -- anyone I've ever taken here is quickly a fan. The meatballs are a solid starter (never dry!), and the pizzas are consistently delicious. There usually is only a single server though, and though they are always wonderful, it's clear that the restaurant requires more than just a single person on their waitstaff. Would recommend to anyone looking for a nice night out!

I live on the same block. I have a 2min walk to Bar Camillo. I'm so glad that the neighborhood is growing and I wish I could be supportive but unfortunately Bar Camillo served the worst Italian food I had ever had in NYC. Ther service was very slow but the food was so bad, it was unbelievable. Other than the bread that was OK only and the Negroni, the Lasagna was terrible and the pizza too. It's so sad, and then again possibly a better chef or better restaurant manegement might be able to help... The space is kind of nice.

We have loved eating and drinking at both locations of Camillo! So happy that we have bar Camillo now that we moved to a new neighborhood. We love Negronis and they have a long list to choose from- tried the plum for dessert las time we visited.

3.5 is my official score. I came to Bar Camillo on a Monday at 7 without a reservation but I was still able to get a table for 3 in the covered & heated backyard dining. Not all tables get the same heat (or any). The table in the back left had no heat. A little unpleasant at first. I tried the Ginger Spritz it was nice and refreshing but I'll stick with Aperol spritz. For our meal we had the meatballs (polpette di manzo) , the artichokes (Carciofi), baked cacio & pepe and the seasonal pinsa special - all'Uccelletto which had pork sausage, Tuscan kale, cannellini & sage puree, tomatoes and mozzarella. I didn't love the pinsa special. It was lacking flavor and the after taste was chalky - weird for pizza, I know. I think that was due to the cannellini beans. The cacio e pepe was good not as peppery as I like and I was shocked to see that they used gentile pasta and not spaghetti. I'm also not a fan of artichokes BUT this was actually very tasty. I would try them again but different items.

Thank you Bar Camillo, for great service on a day where you were so understaffed! Our server was the only man waiting on guests, and he was kind, prompt, attentive! The Negronis were really great, and while we didn't get a seat out in the backyard, it looked very beautiful:)

They need more staff. Food & getting served takes too long. We never got the other drinks we ordered. & we have to stop the waiter in a hurry just to get served & needs met. 3 stars because great playlist & the Food & drinks were good when we did receive them.
Delicious cocktails, cool bartenders, and great atmosphere. We haven't tried the food yet but it smelled and looked delicious! Can't wait to come back here

10/10 would come back again. They have Inferno and Campari cocktails which is amazing. We ate the Formaggi and baked Cacio e Pepe which were exactly what we wanted, as we we feeling like a cheese feast. The wine and beer were also great, wine was on tap hope they have draft beer soon.

Went to Bar Camillo for the first time on a whim for dinner Wednesday night. Had never been before and it's a local spot I had walked by before so I wanted to give it a try. We arrived around 8:00 PM without a reservation and were seated within about 15-20 minutes. I thought it might be quiet on a Wednesday, but while we were waiting someone else asked for a table and we realized 3 other couples were waiting after us! We sat in the back which was cute and romantic. It rained heavily during the meal which actually added to the atmosphere since we were protected by the transparent roof! It was warmer in the backyard than the inside which also looked nice but not uncomfortable as they had fans throughout. My partner and I noticed that it seemed like maybe a server called out; there was one guy literally doing everything from hosting to grabbing drinks to serving food etc. He was a champ! Service was still reasonably paced and I just couldn't believe how good this guy was. Despite doing a million things at once I still felt like he provided personal attention and was easy to get a hold of, like when we wanted the check. Pizza was nice and thin and crispy and filling! Was it the best pizza I've ever had? No, not necessarily. But I liked it overall and enjoyed the service and atmosphere. I would return again with a reservation and try the pasta dishes in the future.

Not sure how I forgot to post this but y'all need to know where the universe is hiding great food. First off, let me say that hands down indoor dining is likely better at this place in both locations but the food makes the noise outside at both locations tolerable. The salad was incredibly low key and delicious.  The pizza crust, sauce, and toppings were all fresh and memorable for the flavor pallette. It was a good time....minus the noise from the cars and area.
Food is amazing. Wait staff is even better. It's such a wonderful place. Terry is the best human.

I really enjoy this place! The atmosphere and food are lovely. Our server Mia was phenomenal, she really made our dinner over the top! She was attentive, informative on the menu and friendly. We will be back, thanks Mia and bar camillo for a great experience.
Been to both their locations, food is great. Their brown spirit selections are excellent, the food is just banging. Pizzas are great but the goat I had so on point!

Idk who these people are leaving 5-star reviews but obviously they have never eaten food before. Salsiccia and greens plate was clearly cooked + seasoned in an underground natural salt deposit. Focaccia was just crusty pita bread with with old rosemary. Cacio e Pepe was served as TJ's Annies shells. I wasnt gonna leave a 20% tip but my gf yelled at me. Overall, my mouth feels more disrespected than Chris Rocks' during the oscars.

Excellent appetizers and pizza with a lovely atmosphere that is clean and friendly. The service is great and is a lovely addition to the neighborhood.
This place was great! We tried the meatballs and artichoke apps, both were great. We split a pizza and the pesto lasagna for dinner- both were also amazing! & the Negronis are a must.
Best Negroni's around! The drinks are amazing-and the staff are always so sweet to help my friends when they come visit. It's been such a sweet and fun experience every time I come here.

We wuz passin by this place that we had odered from before what I like about is different what my gurl likes cuz she knows more about it than me. This place is more than just pizza its like they have different italian foods. I like the pizza doe cuz they have it like the pizza magarita. My girl,likes the pasta and the lasagna.  and they got different beers to drink if u want. we sat outside and it was cool cuz its in bed-stuy.
The food is soooooooooo good. The pizza is fresh and tasty. There is a backyard patio and the delivery was on time with hot food.
Holy shit the food is flavorful and the service is friendly AF and the vibe is supreme
Ordered delivery off Caviar. They sent totally wrong order-tried to call no answer. What a joke! 0 stars!

I went back and tried the Enchiladas Placeras Platter and now I can see much more why people love this place. This dish consisting of, "3 red semi-fried tortillas in our grandmas red special sauce, filled with tinga or refried beans, topped with lettuce, tomato sauce and Cotija cheese," is outstanding and very much worth it for $13. The Tinga Tostadas are also good. Was also a fan of the Mezcalita. I guess when inside a Michoacán restaurant, order Michoacán food (who would have thought.) Will be back again likely to try the tacos Michoacán as I haven't had a good version in a while.

Was craving some Mexican and wanted to try out somewhere I haven't been. Me and a friend walked by Purepecha and decided to give it a try and I'm so glad we did. We felt welcomed by the staff as soon as we walked in. The ambiance is very cute and they have a pretty large menu. We both got margaritas - I got the classic and my friend got the raspberry cadillac margarita which she said was really good. First order of chips and salsa was free and they were really good. I ordered the chicken quesadilla which came with guac and pico de gallo. My friend ordered the shrimp fajitas which were a pretty big portion. We both loved our meals and the service was great. Might be hard to miss with the scaffolding outside but definitely worth a try. I will be returning for sure in the future.

I take out here regularly as it is a solid Mexican place near me. In terms of price it is decent as I can always have enough for two meals! I have only tried the tierra y mar as I am a sucker for a good surf and turf. Also perk if you dine in is that you get free chips and salsa!

The restaurant is in a nice location and the atmosphere is nice. My husband ordered a margarita but they then realized they were out of ice so they sent a worker to go buy more. So he waited about 20 minutes for his drink but they very friendly and apologetic about it. They serve you one basket of free chips and salsa and the chips were obviously old. We both got burritos with grilled chicken. They were decent in my opinion but not as good as I was hoping for. Overall, this is a decent place to grab a bite to eat.

Hidden gem! We got these veggie tacos with avocados and huevos and also a veggie tostada to share. There are a lot more veggie options than I expected which was great, and the service here was so amazing. The waiter was so attentive to us and gave us thoughtful recommendations for food and drinks. Definitely want to come back again!

Ordered for pickup and Im so glad I came across this place. Pretty picky with my latin food. The chicken fajitas were fire. Not so big on corn tortilla but even that tasted good.

This place is fantastic!  I ordered the nachos today and I am so happy I did.  This may be the best nachos I have ever had!  Chips taste great, wonderful crunch.  I like that I was able to choose the beans, the black beans have great flavor.  The cheese was beautifully melted.  The carnitas...wow...great seasoning and generous amount.  I appreciate that they give you the pico de gallo, sour cream, guacamole and salsa verde on the side, avoids nachos from becoming a soggy mess.  Looking forward to trying out the rest of the menu!

Enjoyed this place!  Lovely steak tacos and had the San Angel burrito!  My little one had rice and beans.  Staff was very friendly.  Seems like a great place for margaritas (I did not have but they look delish). Will be back!

This place serves amazing food & margaritas the owner makes is so good lol The owner is super nice and he said he wants to make sure he serves food like he does for his family and I'm glad he opened this place and decided to share his love.

Two words " TRY THEM". Try the al pastor Tacos, Blackberry Margarita and the Queso dip w/chorizo! They never, evaaaaaaa disappoint. The al pastor tacos, they are always rich in flavor, fresh and flavorful. Whether you order to-go or have them there, they are just as delish! My favorite, in Cobble Hill/Carroll Garden area. We are repeat offenders of the Al pastor tacos here  #Guilty‍ The service here is amazing, I never had any issues and we've been coming here since they opened. Would highly recommend.

There are not many great tacos places in Brooklyn Heights / cobble hill / carrol gardens, so this place is easily the best taco spot we have found so far. We got the carnitas, which is really good, on par with other great taco places. The shrimp tacos were also really good. The biria tacos were just ok, I would not get them again (it could be that you need to eat them right away and we got them for takeout). There are some others I want to try again, but in general this is a great spot, reasonably priced as well. Just wish you could order individual tacos - instead of the 3 per order.

Very relaxed setting and delicious food. I got the nachos with steak and couldn't wait for my main entrée. I also got the steak fajitas and they were delicious too! When I'm back in Brooklyn I will come back here!
No comment
I love this place. Authentic tacos. So good. I've never dined in. I've only ordered delivery but entire family enjoys their food and they are all super picky.

No comment
The food was great! The service and the bartenders were friendly, funny and respectful. Played really good music (mixture of all genres).
Yes I recommend the chicken burrito!!  So delicious . I like to eat  in places with authentic Mexican food.

This place is still very delicious! I haven't came since before the beginning of COVID. Purepecha has quite a few tables out for outdoor seating. We came for brunch on Saturday and was able to get seats right away (around 12:30/1pm). I ordered the bandera burrito with al pastor. The burrito is quite large. The al pastor inside was perfectly seasoned! It was juicy and so flavorful. The sauces on top of the burritos were equally delicious. We requested hot sauce and the server provided us a green sauce and an orange/red sauce. The orange/red hot sauce was, in my opinion, not too spicy, but had just the right amount of heat. I'm so glad we came here again!

Great quick meal. Enchiladas are the bomb and the Spicy Margaritas are tame but tasty. Not bad at all.
No comment

I've ordered from Purepecha a few times now and I can honestly say they have some of the best tacos I've had in the area. I've tried their carnitas tacos, the fish tacos, and the carne asada tacos, and they are all delicious. I moved here from San Diego and it's been hard to find good Mexican food out here which is why I'm soooo happy I finally found this spot. They also have really delicious salsa! The only thing I will say is that the food can be a liiiiittle salty sometimes. The flavors are on point but if you have high blood pressure or are trying to avoid salt for any reason then this may not be the spot for you, but other than that the food is truly delicious! I will definitely be a repeat customer

Solid authentic restaurant. I was by the area visiting friends and I stumbled upon this restaurant for dinner. I order the steak quesadilla along with the guac and chips. Steak quesadilla was juiced and full of flavor. They are generous with the guac and chips. I would recommend and come back when I'm craving Mexican food again
Very cute Mexican restaurant. Food was all very good, and I appreciated that they had a vegan fajitas option.
No comment

Ordered online when they appeared as a new listing for tacos in my area. A little less expensive than other spots nearby but also with fewer frills and smaller portion size so I guess everything's proportional. The al pastor tacos were a little lacking on the pineapple but otherwise pretty tasty. Delivery came in half an hour, under their estimated 40-60 minute window. Simple, delicious, what else could you ask for?

I absolutely love this place. The food is great the drinks are always strong and you get free chips and salsa with your order so even better :) The customer service is great as well Kevin and Marco are always sooooo friendly and inviting and that's what keeps me coming.
Just absolutely delicious Mexican food in every detail. Service 10/10, even the decor's nice. Really great little Mexican place.

I've gotten takeout here 3 times.  I always order a carnitas burrito, but this past order I was given steak instead.  It was flavorless and burnt tasting.  I am not a steak person, so maybe this is normal, but I was disappointed with the inconsistency.  The first 2 carnitas burritos were tasty and worth the higher than normal burrito price.
Love this place! The food is excellent and tasty and never disappoints. The service is fast, the drinks are strong. No complaints. (got excited and started eating before the pic)
No comment

I've been here a few times now, at first not super impressed but the more things I try - the more I love this place!  The tostadas are delicious & filling, the chicken is tender and the toppings are plentiful!  My friend loved the veggie (peppers/onions) burrito, and he's not vegetarian.  My last visit, I had the nachos with chorizo - it was EPIC!  The ground chorizo was amazing, I almost contemplated ordering a 2nd plate.  The margaritas are decent, would like to see more options with mezcal.
go to spot for mexican, i have never ate there but we always order delivery and it's very good.

We had an excellent fish taco here. And I admit the service and ambiance were excellent. But all the other food we had- I'm not so sure it's worth all the hype. For example, the highly heralded carnitas tacos were just OK in our book. Maybe a bit below average if we were on the West Coast. And pricey... Just saying...

I came here for dinner with a friend. We shared chips and salsa and each had a margarita. She had the steak/chorizo tacos and I had the fish burrito. Everything tasted fresh. The margaritas were fresh and strong, with a slight tartness that was refreshing. My friend and I enjoyed our meals. Staff was very friendly and attentive. The restaurant is beautifully decorated - it's warm and inviting.

Really delicious and fresh, authentic flavors. We ordered a giant vegetarian burrito, chicken tinga, and guacamole and chips. The burrito was tasty, and the chicken tinga was perfect. Even the guacamole tasted better than your average, very well seasoned and served with homemade chips. Definitely give this place a try, you won't be disappointed!
No comment

The best Mexican in the hood. A bit more but worth it!! Staff is very nice and food taste quality and delicious. We usually get the San Angel Burrito,  shrimp tacos duro, carne tostada, and chips and salsa - their ranchero salsa is so great too. And churros
No comment
Good service, nice that they have TVs to watch the games, but $14 dollars for a Michelada,  C'mon.

Just came in to sit at the bar for  drinks and a snack. Bartender was very friendly in conversation and drinks were good! Definitely a place to stop by if you are in the neighborhood looking for a quick and nice spot

My friend and I came on a weeknight and ordered house margaritas and shared chips and salsa. I was a bit sad that chips and salsa weren't included, but it was fresh & DELICIOUS so I was instantly happy we'd ordered them. The house margaritas weren't anything out of this world, but they were fresh and tarte- none of that overly sweet syrup. Thank heavens! The campechanos tacos have a spicy kick which made the margarita an even better choice. The warm glow of the mural made for a nice ambiance. Overall, a beautiful addition to the neighborhood.

This place has been on Smith Street for at least a year now and I finally decided to try their outdoor dining (due to Covid) about 3 weeks ago. Hmmm what can I see, the flavors are spot on when it comes to Mexican cuisine. I've tried their nachos, steak fajitas, Fajitas Mixta and shrimp tacos. Every dish has been super flavor full and service is great considering staff is low. Cocktails are amazing!! Enjoyable more so during the weekend when there are less people outdoor dining, but a def must try. The best place in Boreum Hill for Mexican hands down.

This is the my favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. The quality of food and drink is very good. The staff is nice and friendly. I've had various food from here and all of it is great! My recent order was steak nachos. Simple but delicious. Sorry, I took the photo after I started eating!

We had a drink that was just okay. The food was not that good. It seems a restaurant to be productive, but doesn't deliver anything that would make me to get back. Not impressed.
My girlfriend and I had a blast. Juan Carlos, Tomas, and Josh took great care of us. Food was fantastic, atmosphere was fun and welcoming. Will be back
No comment

First of all, my friends and I had been waiting over an hour at Congee restaurant and we were so famished, we decided to be adventurous and try somewhere new. We have no regrets!!!! From start to finish, this place was perfect. The decor is so personal and chic; a balance of whimsical, antique, and classy. The waiter was quick to attend to us so we were sat very quickly and my seat had a perfect view Int the chef's kitchen, which I must say was a show to watch with his precision and pace. Also, the kitchen was very clean. The menu is small and everything we ate was absolutely fresh and delicious. We had the salmon, tartine, carpaccio, tartare, Brussels sprouts, Cajun chicken, duck confit, soufflé, chocolate croulant (?) and lemon butter crepe. Oh my god. Utter bliss and indulgent and because everything is tapas style, you get the most amount of flavor in every bite. I'm someone who can get bored very quickly of repetitive flavors and textures, everything was new, flavorful and different. Something as simple as the fig and goat cheese tartine had olive oil and something to give it a kick. It was all so exciting! Even when we were only going to order the croulant and soufflé, the owner was adamant and said no, we must try a crepe. So fluffy, light, and thin. The chef also checked up on us to make sure we were enjoying the food and he was so modest, I almost wish he wasn't. Please, everyone from the waiter, owner and chef - take more credit!!

Loved all the food. Between the three of us we ordered 7 tapas, 3 desserts, 4 cocktails and 2 beers. Loved all the food and drinks. Will defintely come back again. The servers and waiter were wonderful as well. Thank you.

Great atmosphere and location!  Food is excellent, French as though you are in France.  Great service and wonderful cocktails.  The concept is a friendly neighborhood bar with tapas sized perfect plates.  We had four items for two and that made a fantastic dinner.  Lively, fun, neighborly!  You'll enjoy it!

So thrilled they are now open for BRUNCH! Absolutely delicious croque madame, and lots of other options that I can't wait to try next time. Bloody Mary's, mimosas, great coffee, but also the specialty cocktails that are available at night too. Come now before the lines start getting long.

Awesome food/ reasonable price. Drinks were balanced/ unique. Awesome wait staff. The place is tiny but so cute. No real tables just bar areas.Will be going back.

A cosy LES location perfect to unwind on a wintry snowy day. The menu variety makes it perfect to share or not. And sure this is not a diner, nor a steakhouse. Awesome wine bar options with a focus on ingredients and quality, right portion. Chef took time to talk with our party while preparing food, and bartender suggested the right drink to match each of us respective mood. Will definitely come back.

So there is Pardon My French  (a great place) and this place... my gag reflex was in overdrive and I left partially hungry. It's a French tapas place with mediocre food. We tried the Brussel sprouts, duck confit, croque, sliders, and scallops. The croque and sliders were great but considering how subpar everything else was, I may just be desperate. Great service but go somewhere else for food.

An amazing spin on tapas, french style! A true gem not to be missed, from the details of the charming decor to the exhilarating cocktails to the delectable tapas! Chef Johann Giraud has truly  brought a great flair to the art of tapas.

Shockingly bad considering the high review. The mushroom was burnt to a crisp and covered with sandy breadcrumbs, the scallops were fishy, and wine was sickenly sweet. It truly seemed like they had a brand new crew down there. Super disappointed.

Great atmosphere! Both the food and drinks were amazing! We had a variety of drinks, each with French flair. The cheese plate and Brussel sprouts are a must! Be sure to stay past midnight for the French toast and pressed coffee. It's a must go; we can't wait to return next time we visit NYC.

Such a great place, Ricardo makes you feel so welcome and he is hilarious. We stopped by this place by accident and it was amazing. We had French toast at midnight and they were so good, the crepe Nutella was very good too. Great place to sit get some food and drinks and enjoy your night.
Winter happy hour boho select champagnes and wines before 8pm! Very nice decor here and love the hibiscus infused champagne

Our first time in NY we were looking for a true authentic bar to experience a great time and enjoy a unique meal. We came across "Excuse my French" and fell in love upon arrival. The service and energy is amazing! A new and up coming restaurant in the city that will not disappoint! You feel at home while experiencing Heaven in your mouth! Recommend: Authentic Garlic Bread and Lamb Brussels Sprouts!!! A must "go to" if your in the city!!!

SUCH an amazing hole in the wall! Amazing cocktails and there 2 for 1 happy hour is insane!!! Champagne cocktails are unlike anything I've had before (recommended lavender, rose and hibiscus)!! Will definitely be back!

A perfect place to relax in the evening. The cozy atmosphere and attentive staff are so welcoming! I love the escargot and am glad they kept it on the menu after the Bastille Day special.  The yellow fin tuna is really delicious.   L'Antonieta is still the perfect cocktail -sweet, smoky and magical.
Excuse my French has a great ambience and great food with sensational cocktails to match. The host is always dressed well and has a cool warm vibe.

This place would receive a 0 star rating if possible. Worst dining experience EVER! The waiter was incredibly rude and patronizing. He not only mocked us for our drink choice, but he also mocked us for our enthusiasm about receiving our food. However, the tipping point was when he kicked us out, when we still had full drinks, just to try to seat other people. At this point, we had already paid AND tipped incredibly generously....spending a total of over $109 for two people! The food was average, not worth the money. Do NOT recommend.

This is a charming little French bistro that has great ambiance and food. From the street, you walk down a half-flight of stairs and enter the restaurant which gives the place a "Left Bank" feel. Service was prompt and polite. My wife and I shared the fig tartine (our favorite), seared ahi (is that French?), baked mushroom and the Moroccan carrots. The food met expectations and we washed it down with their house red wine which was 2 for 1 glass during happy hour. My only disappointment was that their crepe maker was not working, so we were denied finishing off our meal with their crepe Suzette. Highly recommend this place, but please don't tell anyone else-it's just a tiny little romantic place.

This is a lovely neighborhood spot!!  The interior was recently renovated and poses as a chic library setting with dim lighting and candlelit bar.  They had happy hour from 4-8pm and the bartender Juan Carlo was so sweet and extended this for our entire stay!  My friend and I shared the baked camembert cheese, which was a full meal in it itself.  Will definitely come back here to try the duck confit and beet carpaccio.
Such a fantastic place to unwind with a carefully crafted cocktail. Try the Beet Carpaccio, Brussels sprouts or the delicious Cajun chicken served in a tiny tagine - so warm and comforting!

Simple French flavors come to life by the hands of chef/owner Johann Giraud.  It's a must do in lower Manhattan if you like great food and cocktails. Make sure you seat in front of the kitchen and let Chef take over your dinner. Cheers!

I don't write reviews often, but when i do its because i feel compelled to - this place is great in all respects.

Love this place! I stopped by for a cocktail after work one night and I've been coming back ever since! The food is delicious, especially if you're a fan of crepes like me. Service is prompt and the general vibe is relaxed. Also a great place to bring a date!
Inexcusibly três bien. FRENCH Tapas: brilliant, innovative. Only good French fromage et vin, hospitable staff,  great vibe.

Stopped in here for a light dinner and was really pleased. I had the lavender royale which was delicious - floral and ever so slightly sweet, but nice crispness from the prosecco to keep it balanced. We had some charcuterie and cheese, and the highlight for me was the duck rillette. Would definitely go back to try more plates!

I came to this place on a Friday night wanting to try something new and I regretted it almost immediately. The place is tiny and the service is SLOW. This is not the end of the world but I was caught off guard when the owner/manager, Ricardo, was yelling at another patron. I worked in the restaurant industry for 8 years and never saw an owner/manager yell at a customer like that. Demanding to pay gratuity and being rude. It also seemed li the bill was pretty high. It really made me lose my appetite. The manager/owner should treat customers better.... especially since there is an abundance of restaurants in the LES. Go to hotel Chantelle, Kiki's or barrio chino. This place is NOT worth it.

Fantastic place in every sense and for every sense, the decoration is awesome, very well done. Perfect spot for taking my wife for anniversary. The staff was way to nice, the food is surreal, I'm not into French cuisine but this place changed my mind, I can't remember the name of the dishes but I ate a lot of them as they are not as big as the American standard dish, we are talking tapas here, that's the way it should be, good size though. The tuna dish is great, the sandwich with cheese amazing, the little burgers wow! and the little pickles on top are the best I've where tried! Salmon awesome! The Crepes for desert were way too good to have only one.... Drinks: well the cocktails are really creative and nice, very well presented however I'm more into beers and they have small selection but very nice selection, The guillotine beer is the best French beer I've ever tried. A place to come back next time I'm in NY and recommended to everyone who can make it there, it's worth the train trip while in New York! Cheers to Excuse My French: all the best!

The food is to die for!  Had the cheese, charcuterie plate...drinks....it was wonderful.  Enjoyed the staff and their presentations of the food and drink. Would highly recommend to friends and family, we'll be back!  Staff is excellent!!!
What a gem in lower east side. Small plates, tartines, everything was excellent. The owner makes sure all customers are happy and he is very interactive during dinner.
Delicious tapas, delicious cocktails and incredible ambiance.  The space is tiny, but so well decorated and cozy. Great spot for HH or full dinner.

Amazing place! Johann the chef is a wizard in the kitchen and everything was absolutely delicious!! Brian was our server/bartender and was exceptional! Would highly recommend this place!

My wife had a great "white negroni" but when I ordered a mulled wine, I noticed them putting the glass in the microwave and huddling around it to prevent me from seeing. If you're going to microwave my cocktail, just be honest so I can elect to order a different one! Shows that the mulled wine wasn't fresh and the service not very honest.

An outstanding find. Really well priced and the chef deserves a medal for his solo work in feeding a crowded bar, Great wines and you just gotta have the baked Camembert. It's sublime. The best undiscovered bar around.

Everything about this experience was delightful- the food, cozy and romantic atmosphere, the cocktails and staff. The drinks are tasty and inventive- not your typical ingredients. I love gin and I don't like my cocktails sweet and so they won me over by producing new-to-me gins paired with pine and herb flavors that were almost sour but to me they were crisp and refreshing. I've had drinks with pine in them before but it was way too piney- this was perfectly mixed with just a hint of pine. Next, I'm a Brussel sprout lover and was ecstatic to discover that not only do they not fry them but they seemed lovingly prepared as they were brilliantly colored and roasted to perfection with almond slivers and dried cranberries and drizzled with balsamic reduction. We also had a plate of prosciutto which was a delicious compliment to the Brussels. Finally, Ricardo was a total pleasure to speak with (though fiercely protective of the brussel sprout cooking methods!). Just in case we weren't completely sold on a return visit, he sealed the deal by presenting us with a crepe that was simply to DIE for. And it was their most basic one! I was convinced there was caramel inside but instead was a sort of a caramelized spun sugar. The whole thing was heaven- the crepe was melt in your mouth with the finest butter I'd ever tasted. I will be back again and again!
Service is lovely and it's nice to find a place that has a totally non-hip vibe in a neighborhood that's ultra trendy.  Food is nothing to write home about.

This place is cute and delicious! 2 for 1 happy hour drink special- lavender champagne was great! Highly recommend the buratta salad and the butterfly salmon! Good flavors! This is tapas style we got four dishes between three people and it was enough
Duck confit with smashed taters and truffles. Amazing crepes. Friendly, attentive staff and awesome cocktails.  Yes.
How do you say "mediocre" in French? Yah, unfortunately every dish here is a disappointment. Cute space but poorly executed food.

I actually don't get all the hype here...Yes the decor is cute and the ambiance is good. But the food is just OK and the wine selection is not that great, especially the HH options. I tried and went for full-price ones.

The two of us had the baked camembert, escargot, duck confit, Cajun chicken, and mandarin souflee. The portion sizes were small, but this is a tapas place, so to be expected. The Cajun chicken was underwhelming with regards to spices, but everything else was delicious. The presentation of the duck confit was unique; the duck was layered with mashed potatoes and truffle puree into the form of a tower. The escargot was served still in its shell, so you know it's fresh, and wonderfully bathed in its garlic parsley butter sauce. The sliced baguette served with our food was perfect for dipping, and its exterior was delightfully crisp while its interior was fresh and fluffy. The baked camembert was like an elevated and much tastier form of fondue and the mandarin souflee was like a classy lighter version of cheesecake. We tried a few of the mixed drinks, and loved them all. We honestly had a wonderful experience here, which was guided by our friendly bartender/waiter and the chef, who worked his magic in a small kitchen that sat besides the bar.

I highly recommend this sweet spot on the LES! Had a spectacular evening here a couple of weeks ago while catching up with friends. Beautiful decor, fantastic service, delicious food and expertly crafted cocktails. The staff is so welcoming and knowledgeable, and the atmosphere is perfect for an intimate gathering. Portions are generous and executed beautifully. Cannot wait to go back!
Beautiful space.  Excellent service.  Informative servers who really know their cocktails (and the history behind them.) We had a fantastic evening.
Ambiance is nice but that is about it. Drinks are awful we couldn't take more than 2 sips. The waiter was pushy. We decided not to order food because of the awful drinks so I cannot comment on that.

I wish I had taken photos of the plates but we were too busy diving in and devouring eat bite. The salmon and the duck confit are a must and so is their Brussel sprouts. But my absolute favorite item on the menu was the crepe.. a taste of Paris right in NYC. Chef Johan greeted us and even shared his grandmother's crepe recipe with us when we jokingly asked!!  Will be going back for sure!
One of my favorite bars on the lower east side. Super relaxing after a long day with great service friendly staff and incredible food!!! Definitely recommend

Love this place. Definitely a place for grownups, as another reviewer mentioned. The staff is fantastic and they know their stuff behind the bar. Drink prices are good, especially for the LES. Music isn't too loud, either. My new regular after-work martini stop.
Small and intimate cocktail bar with a nice selection of drinks and tapas style dishes.  The ambiance and service are great. Love this place!!

The staff were kind, but the food (scallops and portobello mushrooms) was not very tasty.
LOVED this place. Excellent drink menu and delicious tapas. Plus a really cool cozy setup. Loved the tuna, salmon gravlax, and so much more. The waiter/bartenders were all super. Really good place!!

Officially my new favorite spot in the lower east side....the atmosphere is cozy, intimate...perfect date spot....the music is at a level that you don't need to strain to have a conversation.  The brussel sprouts with lamb merguez are delicious.

I absolutely love this place! I live very close so I've been a few times and I have never been disappointed. If you get the chance sit at the end of the bar near the Chef - he's very entertaining to watch and is fun to chat with. I've tried to emulate the brussel sprout dish and despite my best efforts it's really just so much better here. Highly recommend for a date, parents in town, friend catch up night -- really anything!

I love this place, the food is great! And it has such a cute back yard! Wish it was summer all year round so I could hang out in it. All the staff are really friendly, and if you don't want to eat you can just hang out by the bar and chill!

we went there about 6;30pm and was pleasantly surprised that the happy hour didn't end until 8:30PM. 2 glasses of wine for the price of 1 and discounted drinks! This is a tapas style place with an emphasis on french style cooking. The food was delicious and I think their most popular dish was a duck comfit which was delicious. If you like to eat family style and enjoy tapas, this is the place to go.

Traveling in NYC for work, looking for french cuisine. Saw the great reviews, tried 6 things and a couple different drinks. Loved it all. Especially the yellowfin and croque monsieur. Great drinks- had The Boxer which was perfect and a purple cocktail w/ interesting back story. The drinks all had good back stories. Hard to explain, but big fan. Highly recommend.
Awesome!! It was my first time there and definitely won't be my last . The food,drinks and ambience all on point !!
Excellent food and warm, friendly atmosphere.  We enjoyed the eggs and salmon as well as the French toast (it is exquisite).

We have dined at this remarkable and elegant restaurant-bar a few times and have always been extremely satisfied with the whole experience:  The chef is OUTSTANDING; the food is exquisite and the menu is very unique; the staff is welcoming and the bar offers an array of unique drinks (fun!).  Also I must mention the cozy atmosphere which is full of French charm, warmth, romance and class (but without the high-prices or pretentiousness).  It's a great East Village location, perfect for a romantic dinner or a Sunday brunch with a group of friends.  It's not to be missed.
Wonderful atmosphere, great drinks, excellent customer service!! I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good drink with an even better story behind it!

Outstanding and unforgettable dining experience at Clover Hill. We were blown away by the attention to detail, flavors, and execution of the menu. It's a small, intimate space perfect for a nice date (maybe not the first, make sure you like them ;)) or a group of 4-5. The service was also excellent and knowledgeable, considering there are 8-9 dishes per seating. I haven't been this excited about a restaurant in a very long time and hope they continue to do their thang!

What can I say. I had dinner at Clover Hill restaurant in Brooklyn Heights to celebrate Lizettes birthday.  It was Michelin Star Chief Mitchell. I can say everything was 100 stars. Food. Service. Presentation. Staff = exceptional.  If you want an experience, this is the place to go. He did his thing. The food was exceptional.  Service was great. Pipper was our host and she was great. Very personal and engaging. Ambiance was awesome.

For all its great reviews and Michelin star, this restaurant was a disappointment.  The food was what one might see in a Michelin level of distinction.  Good, tasty, but not exceptional.  And it was expensive.  Two small rolls with butter was $15.  The other dishes were about a 25 percent higher than most recent two-star and many of the one star restaurants that we have been to in the last three months.  That would be about 12  restaurants.

Being totally honest, I came into this experience with lower expectations. I have had a few similar new one star restaurants in New York...especially Brooklyn that just seemed hype over execution. Enter clover hill. A (literally) hidden gem in an obscure corner of Brooklyn heights. Actually this block in Brooklyn is worth a visit alone. Chef charlie Mitchell is on his way to his second Michelin star very soon. He has taken fine dining and infused it with American spice and excitement. His delightfully filling menu is hit after hit. Once you enter the dark, moody, small interior you are greeted by a friendly and knowledgeable staff. The pace of the meal is just fine. The drink menu is streamlined but solid. If I have one note it is I would love some sort of menu to accompany meal service. Call me old fashioned but I like to read what I'm eating not just heat it. This is a seafood focused menu and I am fine with that. I'd even say no need to upgrade to the meat dish. Fish is what they do so go for the ride. The crab tart was a fun take on the dish and took me to summers on the boardwalk! I could eat that farro porridge every day! So delicious. Check it out!

Amazing. Don't know how else to describe it. What a hidden gem! We had brunch and dishes there are a revelation - it's innovative, delicious, and beautiful. The ambiance made my partner and I to own a place like that were we would take our friends and family to hang out. Beautiful decor. We are sad it's so far from where we live in Manhattan, but we will definitely won't skip it when we are next in the neighborhood.
Brunch was amazing! French omelette was fantastic. Melted in my mouth. The perfect balance for a brunch. My husband enjoyed the pork belly on the side. Will stop by again on the next visit for sure.
Excellent food, service and atmosphere. The tasting menu is very inviting and tastes incredible.

I walked in expecting just a really nice dinner and walked out experiencing culinary art. I was treated to what can only be described as a dining experience from beginning to end. The music was a whole vibe. The staff were wonderful to interact with. The food was outstanding!!! I cannot recommend this place enough. Worth every penny to eat in this wonderful space.

This meal was amazing. Great service too. We reserved the bar (which is a la cart) and we didn't realize, but was July 4th weekend, so was not busy and we got to sit at a table. The tables are normally for the tasting menu, but we had a choice. We did a la cart and loved it! I'm sure the tasting menu is fantastic too. Small  cozy place with such a good vibe. Highly recommend.

We had the most delicious brunch here! We had the hen egg, omelette and pate. They were super accommodating to my gluten allergy. We even had a little dessert. The coffee was delicious, with espresso drinks as good or better than a high quality coffee shop. Will go again!

A lot to like about this place! Attentive waitstaff, creative dishes and nice coffee! I had a latte and the crushed potato with black pepper and fried egg. Everything about the dish was really, really nice though I guess I got kinda bored? Potatoes are awesome but it was really the focal point of the dish and after a while I was like...I just don't want anymore of this. This place honestly left a lasting impression. I'm looking forward to going back. The food was visually pleasing AND equally flavorful, which I feel is rare to come by! The staff was also very welcoming. Great place for a date night or even a nice dinner with friends. Def worth it!!!

Wow!  Every bite was a special occasion. I went to a really famous Michelin star restaurant the day before and this was the place I would return to again. Quaint and charming local neighborhood restaurant but world class food.

Beautiful restaurant with creative and elevated cuisine. Love that it's open for breakfast on the weekends - probably one of the only places in the neighborhood other than chains or diners open before 11am. We had the truffle potatoes and eggs (so rich and delicious!) and the toast with ricotta and pears and got to sit with our toddler in a lovely window seat overlooking the street. We were probably one of the only families so it's not overrun with children but also not unwelcoming to children either. =)

Brunch was absolutely outstanding, down to the perfect toast. The scone was served on cream, and was unbelievably flavorful. I would definitely order the bacon and the truffle potatoes and eggs again. Even the temperatures of everything were perfect.

I LOVE this new restaurant in the neighborhood. It's very welcoming, has a beautiful design, and everything from the cutlery to the sugar bowl is elegant! The music is not too loud so it's a great place to talk and you really feel like you can stay all day. The trout with beets is delectable! The service was very attentive and friendly as well. I love how open it is, it's great for a huge group or even for a more intimate date.
Amazing brunch food. Ordered the trout, monk fish, Apple and celery salad, and pistachio scone and all were excellent.

If you're looking for a warm inviting dining space to settle in and eat phenomenal food, Clover Hill is the place to go to. Exceptional service and a great place to spend time with friends and family who will enjoy themselves!

This neighborhood has been crying out for a restaurant of this caliber for years - ever since Iris Cafe closed. Clover Hill is cozy and approachable while serving up Michelin Star quality food in an affordable tasting menu style experience. They are BYO at the moment, so reservations are highly suggested so that they can steer your beverage purchase based on the nightly menu - another lovely and personal touch that makes it all the more worthwhile.
Masterful flavor combinations. Fresh ingredients. Above average plating. Cozy decor. Welcome to the neighborhood!
Just what the neighborhood needs! Really good, unique food. Cozy setting. Best brunch I've had in a while. The celery and apple salad was a sleeper hit.

This place is fantastic. The best brunch I've had in a very long time. Will certainly be back for more. Try the pistachio scone w satsuma jam and the truffled potatoes and eggs.

This is a fantastic addition to the Brooklyn Heights/ Cobble Hill neighborhood -- the food is creative, carefully crafted, and delicious.  We were very impressed with the quality and the plating. Every dish was something I had never had before... from scallops with salsify (the best scallops I've ever had), goat cheese dumplings with savory cabbage, etc. They change the dinner menu weekly, so it's clear they have a lot more tricks up their sleeve. Our server was very attentive, too. It's a quiet, charming atmosphere in a cozy townhome on a cobble street in Brooklyn. It should be a destination, and definitely worth a trip from Manhattan or elsewhere. The tasting menu at $95 was a good value but the dishes can be ordered off the menu too. And the BYO option makes the evening much more affordable. Really excellent. Michelin star worthy, if they don't have one already.
Had a great time here! The bartender Keith knows what's he's doing, he's very knowledgeable and friendly. Our drinks came out great and the food was good as well.

Great environment, Great Beer. Do yourself a favor and talk to the Cicerone. For those unaware that would be the Beer Master with the mustache. Good food and a knowledgeable staff make this place worth a trip over.

Suits and brews in the middle of Manhattan's the financial district. Not your typical location for a bier hall but nevertheless a darn good break from walking around skyscrapers all day. Great food and atmosphere. It's a gem bier hall in lower manhattan. Perfect for drinks with co-workers. Heating lamps throughout the tented outdoor area. :)

Went after work and it's a pretty great place to grab a drink if it isn't too cold out (too small on the inside but plenty of outdoor space). Good service and great selection of beer. Excellent beers. Stopped in on a Sunday night and it was pretty quiet. The staff was very friendly and awesome. Great ambiance.

Went to the Clinton Hall in the BX on the first day it opened. Pretty cool environment with a ton of hype and right near my apt so I wanted to check it out. Service was slow as I expected on the first day - totally understand. Given the restaurant's presence on social media I was expecting some awesome food - to say I was underwhelmed would be an overstatement. I am a college student and by no means a great chef but I am confident I could prepare an overcooked burger and soggy waffle fries. Given Clinton Hall entering a college market in the BX, where rent is significantly cheaper than Manhattan, maintaining the same prices seems unreasonable to me. Paying 17 dollars for a burger and fries is exorbitant for the BX. Additionally, on the menu the burger was priced at 13 dollars and we got the check it was 17 for the fries, an additional charge we were not made aware of. The reason I actually took to writing this post, something I would never do normally, was because rather than the owner being understanding of the misinformation we were given he insisted on charging us the additional money. I am not saying 4 dollars is going to break the bank, but to put a largely untrained wait staff in that awkward position and not being reasonable in the first hour of operation was not a way to form a loyal bond with friends who live 1 minute away from your new restaurant.

Enjoyed the food (sliders were great, potato pancakes, pretzel!), beer and games! Cool place in a low key area. Beware of your ping pong ball ending up in the street, choose to play on the safe side :-)

It seems to be most lively for happy hour nearly every week day and a moderate crowd on the weekends. There aren't a lot of local watering holes around here so some may call it a godsend...One of the few places in the area where you can grab a drink and enjoy some ping pong, life-size jenga or connect four, or foosball (definitely a plus!). I've tried the food a few times and haven't been impressed...I'm still trying to figure out what is worth ordering. If you're planning on stopping by during the weekend for some day activities, it's not the best location to catch any rays since it's tucked away from the sun and the scaffolding around the building doesn't help.

I came here after work with a bunch of co-workers and we sat outside. Our waiter was very attentive and super nice. I ordered a glass of Cabernet...it tasted a little weird, so he immediately brought out another for me. He also did a great job accommodating all of our orders - we had quite a large group. Service was fast and the food was great. I would recommend!

The food was great, but I was pretty disappointed by my experience. I ordered the donut grilled cheese and was super excited, but I took one bite and immediately had to spit it out because it was filled with bacon. I didn't see bacon in any of the videos online, but more importantly it wasn't in the description on the menu. I have worked in the food industry for years and thought it was strange it wouldn't say there was bacon in it, especially because there are so many people in New York that don't eat pork. They didn't offer to make me another, so I had to pay $15 for something I only had one bite of. I thought I should at least get a discount. I'm not picky and very, very rarely send anything back (only if it has pork or something I'm allergic to and it's unstated), but I double checked the menu and it didn't say anywhere that there would be bacon on it. I really wish it had said something on the menu so I didn't misorder and waste my money!

I had to try this place after seeing the fondue burger online. When I got there we sat down and it took a while for the waitress to get to us, there were only 2 or 3 other tables so it wasn't very busy. When she brought us our drink order she brought me the wrong drink, but upon trying it I actually really liked it, so I didn't complain. It was a grapefruit beer, it sort of reminded me of orange soda. So next my fondue burger comes. It's nothing special. It's a burnt piece of beef with a hole in the middle for French fries. The cheese over it tasted just like melted American cheese with nothing else added to it. After all the hype it was sort of disappointing. My boyfriend got the parmesan crusted burger. I thought it was better than the fondue burger but I wasn't really wowed. The atmosphere seems really fun though, and they had a long beer list. The prices aren't bad, seems like a good spot for drinks, I would consider giving this place a second try.
I am new to the area and stumbled upon this amazing spot! Great selection of beers and fun games to play. Huge outdoor space with heaters. I am definitely coming back soon with friends

I ate here during opening week. My roomie and I wanted to give it a try since it's in the 'hood. Yay we finally have a beer garden! I had a chorizo on a pretzel bun. Wasn't bad. The bartender was really nice and made small talk. It is a very relaxed atmosphere. Perfect for lazy afternoons or drinks after work. They also deliver which is great if you're craving bratwurst on a Tuesday evening.
No comment

not a beer drinker, but they made a delicous margarita.  highly recommend for a work happy hour.  the bbq wings were also a win. very filling for a late night nosh. definitley get those. they still come with carrots, celery and a decent blue cheese.

Living in the Financial district, it is hard to find a place with a great beer list. Checked this place out last night and was not disappointed. Very cool indoor/outdoor beer hall with a great selection of drafts and very knowledgeable bartenders. I will definitely be back!

We had a great visit on Monday night.  We were staying at the Holiday Inn across the street and  I'll admit I can be a little intimidated by craft beers but our server Maggie did a great job finding out what we liked and making great suggestions for us!  We had such a great experience  we will definetly be back!!!

I came here on a rainy week day and my initial thought upon entering was THIS LOOKS LIKE A BEER GARDEN! I didn't really know what it was until I got there, but what a good location for one! Despite the rain, the "garden" part of the establishment was nicely shielded from the rain  with heat lamps :) They give off raffles for free beer during happy hour (if you order a beer). I cannot vouch for the food here, but I did see a good selection of beer! I opted to stick to my Jack and Diet Coke while my friend did his Jack and Sprite, both super strong (thank you!). We both had a blast and can say that it was a good spot for a date. Ones usual date spots would be dinner and a movie right? Why not switch it up and enjoy a game of ping pong! They also have a foosball table right behind the ping pong table. Overall, I had a great time here and the waiter was SUPER attentive (my drink was never empty!). This place would be perfect for the summer days that are slowly (but surely) approaching!

Stopped by here this afternoon after a day of site seeing.  Met a nice man whom I would guess is a manager or owner and he was super nice. We ordered a burger and a salmon burger, beer and a cider. Great food, good prices, nice atmosphere. They serve Stone beer and. Sing from San Diego this is a loach brew for us so my husband loved it.  Great location and lots of seating.  Wish we had found this before today as we are leaving tomorrow.  My husband liked it so much he bought an empty beer growler to take home.

It's a cute venue, but I literally live above the place and I don't bother going anymore because the service is so consistently poor. Three times I've gotten up and left before a server has come, and twice I've left the bar for being overlooked during slow hours.
Great selection of beer.  Fun lively ambiance. Excellent service. Amanda C our server was awesome. She was fun and upbeat and we thoroughly enjoyed our company summer party :)

Hand-down, one of the better beer gardens I've checked out while here in NY. The staff there are incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and passionate about their beer. I first went there a year ago during NFL playoffs. The general manager (typical skinny mustached beer enthusiast/hipster) recognized I was from Philly, so he turned on one of the TVs to the Eagles game, which I really appreciated. I've probably checked out the placed about once a month since then. The staff slowly get to know you and your taste for beer, recommending stuff and letting you try new products on tap before buying. Great bar food, paired well with the constant rotating beers on tap. They've had a few cool beer events recently. I like the deck area, which has fun bar games (ping pong, jenga, foosball, etc). The crowd seems to be adult professionals who appreciate a good beer while in the Financial District. If you're in the area, check it out. If you're not in the area, take the trip and still check it out.

This place is awful, maybe they were having an off day? Don't know and don't care. Ordered the Bacon Egg burger and asked for just one one bun because I don't like the top bun w/e get over it...especially with a nice egg on top. My burger comes out and looks dry as hell, bacon was burnt to a crisp, the egg was SO overcooked...burger eggs are always runny, this shit looked like a hard boiled egg with a dress on..GROSS! also NO sauce that's supposed to come with it (Clinton Hall sauce) and the bun they decided to discard was THE BOTTOM BUN, like wtf?! So I got a sorry ass dry af burger, with charred bacon, a hard boiled egg on top, no sauce and a bun hat. It looked like they just totally forgot about the order and slapped together the overcooked food, forgot things and sent it out not caring. It's been YEARS since I sent food back but this monstrosity definitely got sent back...oh yah my friend said her wings were gross too. The only saving grace was how friendly and attentive their servers were, they provided good service and were totally cool about me sending back the burger, especially after seeing what I got, they followed up to make sure the 2nd thing I got was good and were very nice the whole time.

came in on a thursday night with friends who had never been this far downtown, i must say it was a cozy and fun atmosphere, music on point!, BEER I MEAN DELICIOUS. they have a wonderful selection. nothing ordinary. i had my favorite founders beer here, and it was cold and tasty. my friends and i loved the service we sat at the bar for a few drinks, came outside to the patio and wow i mean PING PONG? it felt like college. we then had a lovely waitress come over and offer us food and of course we said yes, i mean bratwurst with my belgian ale YES PLEASE! great food for such a small place. management really know what they are doing with the staff very attentive, wish it had more tvs outside but nevertheless it was awesome. coming back with more friends to play some foozeball and watch october baseball. i would def reccomend this place to my friends and family.
I had a great time here, food, beer selection, service, and prices - all were totally reasonable and worked out just fine!  I will definitely be going back.

The beer is fine, but we had the worst service I've ever had at a beer hall. They didn't complete our orders (so, the sides that were supposed to come with our burgers did not come, etc), forgot us, never brought glasses for water (even though we asked repeatedly) ... however, we noted that the tip is included in the bill, so there's no incentive to do a good job, I guess. For $8 per beer, I'd prefer to go somewhere that will pay attention to me, and that will let me tip in a way that rewards the service given.
Very impressed with this place. Stumbled on it because it was across from my hotel. The bartenders were great and the food hit the spot.

This is a great beer garden with delicious food. There's finally something to do in the Financial District! They have a good selection of great beers and the food is delicious. They had a slightly rocky start as a business (disorganized and confused staff) but in the middle of the second week, they're getting their shit together. I look forward to coming back often!
I don't think this place is that great.  I cannot rate the food but the service is terrible and the beer is very overpriced.  I would not return based on the poor service and confused staff.

I stopped in with a large group and figured a beer garden would be a great move. I couldn't have been more disappointed. I waited 15 min for even a look from the bartender. We had to try a table that opened up outside or we were gonna have to leave. Only a little better luck there. They seemed to be terribly short staffed. Every round we had. We were forced to order another one when we were served (to just hope that we would get some type of service with the next round). Only pints (they were out of our first choice on the menu). NO pitchers. I asked the waitress what the problem was and the reply was that there was only one bartender on duty. Can't make it up. We received the bill and were surprised that were getting hit with a 20% gratuity automatically included. It would have been nice to have known that before hand. It's a nice location but needs a manger on duty and another bartender or I don't know how it will stay in business. I hope you have better luck... if you decide to try this place out.
we had Paul as our server at Superbowl and he was awesome!!! food was great, he was very patient with us and speedy with service.

Arrived at the end of week three since their open and I was happy with the scene which was quite packed with the after work crowd. The environment is very sociable and relaxed. I assumed many were first timers like myself and occasionally gazed around to check what others were sampling. Nothing stood out except for the bucket of mussles. My friend and I ordered burgers and a krainerwurst to sample. I opted for the cider option to accompany my burger and my friend went with the pilsner. The cider was actually one of the best I have tasted, hense why I ordered two more. Service seems to be much improved from what others have stated but I did notice that there was a self-service area that may leave you guessing. The manger seemed to be on top of the staff to whip them into shape and they were very attentive in the busing and table side services. We both ordered our burgers medium, mine was closer to medium well but the taste and consistancy of the meat made it nothing worth recommending. The sauteed onion topping wasn't bad. The sausage was a completely dissappointing fatty hot dog with a bunch of fries to compensate for the itsy bitsy tiny winy size. Fries on top of fries is what resulted after finishing my burger and questioning the accompanyment of a stand alone pretzel roll. After this, to be slapped with an 80+ dollar bill really felt like an insult. Pricing here needs to be put in check as other establishments are offering better options with happy hour promotions. Shake Shack is a five minute walk away and a decent bar is right next door at Regis Royal and I am not promoting those options but for what it is worth I would have been more content walking over to Shake Shack buying two burgers and a case of cidre and chilling by PJ Clarks at the North Cove.

The wagyu beef and sauce pairings were delicious - so succulent and juicy. You just want more of each bite. Whether it was the a5 wagyu beef, the American style wagyu or the pork belly, each bite was well thought out and worth savoring. The one reason this didn't merit 5 stars was the service. I mentioned my egg allergy at the start of the meal, and they highlighted the two dishes that could be an issue. They didn't really offer substitutions - just provided me with the dish sans egg. That was fine - until we got to the dessert, which was ice cream. It was one small scoop, and I ate most of it when the telltale tingling and swelling in my throat started. I asked the server if there was egg in the ice cream and she said yes. Suffice it to say, this was not the best way to end the meal. My husband was upset because this was our anniversary dinner, but fortunately, I was able to throw up my most recent bites. The servers expressed very little concern or remorse. And we paid and left. It's fortunate for them that I don't have a more severe allergy (worst is an upset stomach and hives). They had no way of knowing that, but for the amount you're paying and experience they're aiming to give you, you'd think they'd do a little more on the service side of things, especially when they made an error that could have ruined a celebratory evening.
